## app.App interface

A Firebase app holds the initialization information for a collection of services.

Do not call this constructor directly. Instead, use  to create an app.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
interface App 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [name](./firebase-admin.app.app.name.md) | string | The (read-only) name for this app.<!-- -->The default app's name is <code>&quot;[DEFAULT]&quot;</code>. |
|  [options](./firebase-admin.app.app.options.md) | [AppOptions](./firebase-admin.appoptions.md) | The (read-only) configuration options for this app. These are the original parameters given in . |

|  [delete()](./firebase-admin.app.app.delete.md) | Renders this local <code>FirebaseApp</code> unusable and frees the resources of all associated services (though it does \*not\* clean up any backend resources). When running the SDK locally, this method must be called to ensure graceful termination of the process. |
